title: Newtons third law - block pushing another block

content.question: A rope pulls a block of mass <math alttext="2 m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></math> to the right along a horizontal surface, as shown in the left figure. The block of mass <math alttext="2 m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></math> exerts a force on a block of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> with magnitude <math alttext="F sub 2 m, comma m, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>m</mi></mrow></msub></math> that varies with time, as shown in the graph on the right. The blocks remain in contact during the time interval shown in the graph. Which of the following correctly shows the magnitude <math alttext="F sub m, comma 2 m, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mrow><mi>m</mi><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></mrow></msub></math> of the force that the block of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> exerts on the block of mass <math alttext="2 m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></math> during the same interval?

choices.label: The figure shows a line segment in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “F sub m, comma 2 m, end sub.” The line segment begins on the vertical axis, one unit above the origin, and slants upward and to the right. It passes through a point 3 units to the right of the vertical axis and 2 units above the horizontal axis. It ends at a point 6 units to the right of the vertical axis and 3 units above the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a line segment in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “F sub m, comma 2 m, end sub.” The line segment begins on the vertical axis, one unit above the origin, and slants upward and to the right. It passes through a point 3 units to the right of the vertical axis and 3 units above the horizontal axis. It ends at a point 6 units to the right of the vertical axis and 5 units above the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a line segment in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “F sub m, comma 2 m, end sub.” The line segment begins on the vertical axis, one unit above the origin, and slants upward and to the right. It ends at a point 6 units to the right of the vertical axis and 2 units above the horizontal axis.

The figure shows a line segment in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “F sub m, comma 2 m, end sub.” The line segment begins on the vertical axis, one unit above the origin, and slants downward and to the right. It ends at a point 6 units to the right of the vertical axis and on the horizontal axis.

content.answer: The figure shows a line segment in a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled “Time,” and the vertical axis is labeled “F sub m, comma 2 m, end sub.” The line segment begins on the vertical axis, one unit above the origin, and slants upward and to the right. It passes through a point 3 units to the right of the vertical axis and 2 units above the horizontal axis. It ends at a point 6 units to the right of the vertical axis and 3 units above the horizontal axis.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
